The Sutra of AmitÄbha's Inconceivable Spiritual Powers, with an appended record from the Sui Dynasty, author unknown:

In the past, the masters Sengrui, Huichong, Sengxian, and Huitong of Chang'an, and later the Chan masters Shi and Jing, and Chan master Luan of Xihe, and so on, more than a hundred people, were all reborn in the Western Paradise.
Chan master Chao of Xihe and others, seeing that Chan master Luan was reborn in the Pure Land, each led their followers to exclusively cultivate the practice of rebirth in the Pure Land;
Master Chao also compiled a record of verifications of rebirth in the West, called the Collection on Peace and Bliss, which circulated widely.

Furthermore, during the Jin Dynasty, master Yuan entered Mount Lu and did not leave for thirty years. He then ordered the one hundred twenty-three people of like mind, both monastics and laypeople, to establish vows and aspirations for the Western Paradise, and carved them into the mountain.

By the Tianjia years of the Chen Dynasty, Chan master Zhen of Mount Lu, while sitting, saw several hundred people together riding a seven-jeweled lotus boat going to the Western Paradise. Chan master Zhen then sought to join them.
The people on the boat reported:

Although the Dharma Master's lectures on the Nirvana Sutra are also greatly inconceivable causes, the Dharma Master has not yet recited the Amitabha Sutra and its incantations, so he cannot go together.
The Dharma Master then abandoned his lectures and devoted himself day and night to reciting the Amitabha Sutra and its incantations, totaling about 20,000 recitations.
Before the end of the first seven days, around the fourth watch of the night, a divine person sent a white silver platform from the west, its light surpassing the sun, and said:
When the Dharma Master's life ends, he will ride this platform to be reborn in Amitabha's land, so he has come to show this to him, to let him know he will definitely be reborn there.
At the end, both Buddhists and laypeople all heard music playing in the sky, and they also smelled a strange fragrance that lasted for several months.
That night, the monks of Fengding Temple all saw dozens of torches in a valley, as big as cart wheels.

Investigating ancient and present times, those who are reborn in the Land of Bliss are not one, and many see the welcoming of the transformed Buddha's assembly, with spiritual auspiciousness like that widely explained in the biographies, which cannot be recorded in detail.
Because Chan Master Yin Zhen had verification in this sutra, he briefly described this one item to enlighten future scholars, assisting in the aspiration to be reborn.
